oai_dc:dc.dc:title: "The Rebel" newspaper from Chattanooga, August 9, 1862
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This edition of the Chattanooga-based Confederate newspaper reports on the conduct of the war in Virginia, the arrest of "Copperhead" Sen. Clement T. Vallandingham, and the murder near Knoxville of Confederate Gen. William R. Caswell by a party of armed; men. Speaking of Unionist East Tennessee, it says "a good many East Tennesseans, with treason in their hearts, left and went over to the bosom of King Abraham [Lincoln]."
